bibl.title: Letter from Henry E. Sigerist to Philip Showalter Hench, January 28, 1941

div1.p: Sigerist informs Hench that Johns Hopkins is unable to publish Hench's various papers as a monograph.

div1.head: Letter from Henry E. Sigerist to Philip Showalter Hench, January 28, 1941
div1.opener:
THE JOHNS HOPKINS UNIVERSITY
INSTITUTE OF THE HISTORY OF MEDICINE
1900 EAST MONUMENT STREET
BALTIMORE, MD.
January 28, 1941
DIRECTOR'S OFFICE
Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
102-110 Second Avenue, S.W.
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Very many thanks for your letter of January
22. Under the circumstances I think that the best for
you would be to publish your various contributions as
a monograph.

In the past I have several times printed a
series of papers and then published them as a monograph
but I am afraid that I cannot do it any longer. The Bulletin
has about reached its limit in size, and I have so much
material to publish that I must restrict myself to short
papers. I am sending you enclosed a reprint of a preface in
which I have discussed my editorial policy.

Your studies are extraordinarily interesting
and I am sure that a monograph on the subject would be
extremely welcome.
div1.closer: Yours very sincerely, Henry E. Sigerist HES:T
